bestBHT.bht: In this account, the truthfulness of Jesus' ability to provide is confirmed through the recollection of the miraculous feeding of thousands with meager resources. Believers are warned against distress or doubt, as they reflect serious lack of wisdom and sensitivity. Instead, they are encouraged to have faith in Jesus' unsurpassed capability to meet their needs abundantly. These past instances of His miraculous provisions serve as a powerful reminder of His unchanging faithfulness and the boundless depths of His care.

Philip Schaff: This difference incidentally confirms the truthfulness of the account.
John Gill: Have you forgot the other miracle done but a very little while ago, when I fed four thousand men, beside women and children, with seven loaves and a few small fishes?
Distress not yourselves about this matter; give not way to unbelief, which must argue great stupidity and insensibility.
Am I not able to provide for you?

bhtAttempts.bht: In Matthew 16:10, the commentators emphasize the power of Jesus to provide for His followers, reminding readers of His previous miracles such as feeding thousands with a few loaves and fishes. They urge believers not to be distressed or doubt His ability to meet their needs, highlighting the foolishness and insensitivity of unbelief. This reinforces the truthfulness of the account and strengthens the faith of those who trust in Jesus' provision.

In Matthew 16:10, the truthfulness of Jesus' ability to provide is confirmed by recalling the miraculous feeding of thousands with little food. Distress and doubt are unwarranted, as they reflect great stupidity and insensitivity, while faith affirms His power to meet all needs.

In this verse, the account of Jesus' ability to provide for His followers is affirmed by the commentators. They remind us of the previous miracle where Jesus fed thousands with a small amount of food, highlighting His unmatched power. They urge believers not to be distressed or doubt His provision, as it reflects great stupidity and insensitivity. Trusting in Jesus' sufficiency is the antidote to unbelief and guarantees His faithful care.

In this passage, the truthfulness of Jesus' ability to provide is confirmed by pointing to the miracle of feeding thousands with only a few loaves and fishes. Believers are warned against distress and doubt, as it displays foolishness and insensitivity. Instead, they are encouraged to trust in Jesus' unmatched power to meet their needs. His miraculous provisions serve as a reminder of His faithfulness and the unfathomable depths of His care.

In this account, the truthfulness of Jesus' ability to provide is confirmed through the recollection of the miraculous feeding of thousands with meager resources. Believers are warned against distress or doubt, as they reflect serious lack of wisdom and sensitivity. Instead, they are encouraged to have faith in Jesus' unsurpassed capability to meet their needs abundantly. These past instances of His miraculous provisions serve as a powerful reminder of His unchanging faithfulness and the boundless depths of His care.
